definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident

sentences.chinese: “我很遭罪，”她说，“您能给我一片药吗？

sentences.english: And it's the children who suffer.
Once you start to change him, it?s your starting point to a suffering journey.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你开始改变他，你就要开始遭罪了。

sentences.english: When the general atmosphere is bad, language must suffer.
sentences.chinese: 当大环境不好时，语言必然会遭罪。

sentences.english: It truly is a chore to be forced to write all this build code by hand.
sentences.chinese: 而且Ant用手来编写所有的构建代码确实很遭罪。

sentences.english: I washed the dishes thinking of my parents having fun while I feel so exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 当我洗碟子时，我在想象父母在享受而我却在遭罪。

sentences.english: and when the economy is bad, art is the first thing to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 经济不景气的时候，艺术是最先遭罪的。

sentences.english: Too many men look like hell and don't need to.
sentences.chinese: 许多男人看起来很遭罪，其实并不需要这样。

definition: to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
to be born under an ill star
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to love dearly/to feel sorry for sb/to regret/to grudge/to be distressed
